snippet: The increase in murders of police officers, up almost 40 percent in a year, has led to fears that a powerful criminal organization is restarting a war of retaliation.
abstract: More than 70 police officers have been killed in 2012 in Sao Paulo, Brazil; sharp increase in murders of officers, up almost 40 percent since 2011, has raised fears of a resurgence of the First Capital Command, a criminal organization that carried out a four-day uprising in 2006 during which almost 200 people were killed.
lead_paragraph: The increase in murders of police officers, up almost 40 percent in a year, has led to fears that a powerful criminal organization is restarting a war of retaliation.

headline.seo: Spike in Police Officer Deaths Alarms São Paulo
headline.main: Alarm Grows in São Paulo as More Police Officers Are Murdered
headline.print_headline: Alarm Grows in São Paulo as More Police Officers Are Murdered
